Most Illustrious Sir

With the losses I suffered after the concordat I obtained on September 15, 1831, I was almost unable to exactly fulfill the obligations I had contracted by the same, and now, due to the political movements that have taken place in the Province, I not only find myself entirely deprived of the ability to put such duties into action, but also, if at such a time I tried to sell the existing goods, besides not finding anyone who would purchase them, they would be considered of such low value that it would amount to a total loss, thus causing serious harm to my creditors and to myself in particular. In view of so many reasons, I dare to beg Your Excellency
